Reviews.Title: “We had a problem with this hotel!! Please read this!!!”
Reviews.Author: Esra K
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel in November 2011 (three persons). Although we paid the full amount of our stay, they unfairly took another 142 pounds from our bank account. We informed the hotel management immediately and they still did not pay the money back. It has been more than 4 months already and no one is answering our emails. This hotel is very poor in terms of management and service. They are really ignorant and disrespectful. I will sue this company.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent manager, superb location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Gavin I
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Admiral, 143 Sussex Gardens and cannot comment on its sister Hotel Kingsway Park, although the reception area of both hotels is inviting and the staff are extremely welcoming. I found the Admiral to be very good value. It is just a few minutes from Paddington Station and the fact that the hotel is located on a pedestrian frontage away from the main road means that it enjoys a quiet location and gets little street noise. The manager of both hotels, Mr Kin is excellent. He is friendly, welcoming, professional and very helpful and deserves all possible accolades for the charming way that he manages a busy hotel operation split across multiple buildings. He is an enormous asset to the business and a consummate hotel professional. He is the star of these businesses. The Admiral's rooms are very clean, tastefully decorated, modern facilities and are of a very acceptable standard. The ground floor bar and breakfast area would not be out of place in a boutique hotel that could easily charge x 2 times the price. The design concept of the area is very good and the breakfast service itself was perfect. The one draw-back is that the Admiral does not have a lift and the upper stair floors are a bit narrow which would be difficult for guests with challenges or heavy luggage. That said, the main reception at Kingsway has a large storage area and welcome lounge with comfy couches and travellers could easily leave their main luggage there so that they did not have to take heavy luggage to the upper floors. In summary the location and management is excellent and this hotel offers very good value for money. Over 20+ years I have been coming for short stays to London and the Admiral is one of the best places I have seen recently and with the care taken by its manager Mr. Kin I would certainly be persuaded to stay there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Awful. Very dissapointing!”
Reviews.Author: EmmyB1
Reviews.Content: After much concideration I booked this hotel and sent them a message as it was my husband birthday weekend and I wanted to pamper him a little.... NO response! I should have realised how poor this place was going to be when we had to check into this 'family run b & b' 3 doors down the road! reception was shabby, when i asked what time the bar opened he said it was closed because it cost them money to have someonw serve! they advertise this hotel and family run with bar etc etc... what a crock! our double room was a tiny triple, no hot water and no toiletries (not even loo paper) really really dissapointed. My husband was livid. We handed our room key back and left within 20 mins. I managed to find a best western a 4 min walk away. they were £196 for thur, fri & sat night. £16 more expensive but a million miles away from the Admiral! Do not reccommend this 'motel' unless your a dirty old man wanting a room for the evening! Chaps in local bar said its well know because you can rent a room for a couple of hours! need I say more. Not our sort of thing. Happy to sacrifice the first nights cost so I could leave!

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: MCha115
Reviews.Content: after reading the reviews on trip advisor i was a bit worried about going to this hotel. It was very nice, clean the breakfast was excellent and the staff were great. Mr kin the manager was very helpful and polite and so were the rest of the staff at the reception. The room was cleaned every day. I recommend this hotel and the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “go elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: lee2806old
Reviews.Content: checked in at sister hotel 2 doors down, then sent to another sister hotel across the road ( large family!)..booked this hotel because it had a triple room ( Â£120.00 p/night) really small dated rooms with the smallest toilet/shower rooms ever, so small the sink was in the bedroom ! breakfast (after the queue) was basic and a free-for -all... top tips...pay more and stay elsewhere! simple

Reviews.Title: “Cozy environment and fair value”
Reviews.Author: Michelle Z
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with this hotel. Rooms well equipped and nice breakfast. Great location. I was astonished when the owner treated us out for a dinner, amazing experience! I wish all hotels treated me for dinner haha :-D All in all great stay in London!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: scottishthistle21
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights and nothing to complain about, very good experience. We were given larger rooms as no singles left. Nice, clean and comfortable. Bathroom spotlessly clean as were linen and towels. Flat screen tv, kettle and hairdryer. Nice breakfast room and plenty to eat. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fair Stay @ A Fair Deal...No Frills, London Budget Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RangeRover29
Reviews.Content: We booked a two night stay on the spur of the moment, for a short break in "The Smoke". The hotel is very convenient for West London being a short walk from Paddington and the tube. It is definitely a budget, no frills, tourist hotel. Do not expect courtesy or politeness from the staff, as they don't do that, especially the Korean manager. You book in,pay your bill and book out without a thank you or any pleasantries whatsoever. The room wasn't too bad to be honest for such a hotel, a bit grubby in places, but the bed was changed daily, and the tiny bathroom was adequate. I would warn you that leaving your luggage in the reception area isn't particularly secure, as they just pile stuff around the room with lots of other baggage and they don't give you a receipt ticket...so you could end up losing stuff. We took the risk and were lucky, but it is a gamble!....All in all, not great, but not bad if you don't expect too much!

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: cesblake
Reviews.Content: It is a perfect hotel for London, everything is close by, like stores, restaurants, train, tube bus stations; it is a very clean hotel, and staff is friendly; prices are fair; I would definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel was terrible, dirty, over booked and the Hotel Manager is very rude !!d”
Reviews.Author: LindsayKaren
Reviews.Content: I booked a double and triple room at this Hotel last November to stay last weekend. When we arrived the Hotel Manger Kim said it was over booked and did nt have our triple room and could offer us 2 doubles and a single in the hotel down the road, no apology was given and I found him the most un helpful person I have ever come across. He blamed the over booking on Booking.Com, even though he had our booking a long time prior to arrival. The single room was no bigger than a shoe box and smelt terribly of damp, so as you can imagine it was a very uncomfortable stay for that poor guest. My room was on the top floor again it smelt and was extremely hot. We stayed for 2 nights and every time we returned to the room the card swipe key didnt work and we had to walk back down 4 flights of stairs to the reception for them to re activate it. The bathroom was filthy the door was hanging off its hinges. At breakfast we were told to go to the hotel a few doors up and then were promptly returned to our hotel. The man working in the breakfast room had the worst body odour I have ever smelt, all in all we were very disapointed. When we checked out we were told the card machine wasnt working and we had to go to the cashpoint, strangley enough when we returned it was working again !! When we told the manager of our miserable stay he didnt apologise once instead he said we shouldnt of booked through booking.com. The reason for the over booking was because a guest had to stay on longer as one of their party was taken to hospital which of course was fair enough, however the attitude of 'Kim' was well it isnt my fault I have 200 guests to keep happy, To be honest a sorry and a smile would have been enough. All in all I would not recommend anyone staying here at all. The location was very good but there are so many Hotels in this area you will have no problems finding one.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here - horrible!!”
Reviews.Author: Canwejustfam
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on proximity to Paddington Station. That is the only thing it has going for it. The desk clerk addressed me by first name and then tells me he is the manager and his name is MR. "whatever". Put your nose down buddy, you work in a dump. We had more than one room. The "free" internet never worked (one computer in reception). They charged us additonal 5% for using a foreign credit card. Be warned the bathroom pic appears to be the one in the hotel made just for pics. Others in our group had to come and use our bathroom as theirs were so small and awful - two of the bathrooms seemed like they were taken from old motor homes. One reeked of urine. One shower curtain was barely hanging due to being torn. Some of the towels looked like rags and had holes. Two of the shower gel dispensers were broken or empty. The beds are so old the springs poke you.The window handle/lock in one room was barely hanging. The wiring is exposed and seems unsafe. The morning desk clerk was snoring (we there 15 minutes while waiting for all our group) and then woke up and was rude when we all were walking out the door saying we had to pay which of course we did upon check-in. There were parts of tvs or something just thrown next to the sofa in the reception area. Horrible horrible hotel. It should be condemned.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: simvic1
Reviews.Content: I spent weeks trying to find a reasonable hotel in London for my little boys birthday. The Admiral looked clean, fresh and the price was good, according to their website! The location was very good too! But when we arrived the reception showed signs of a run down hotel, grubby and tatty. We were given our room card and went next door as the Admiral does not have a reception. Our room was upstairs, I have to say my heart sunk it was awful, the radiator and paint work was caked in dirt and the cupboards and doors smeared with dirt. I sat on the bed and the mattress was that old I could feel the base. I peeled back the sheets to find hairs and a stain which was coming from the mattress protector, I peeled back the bottom sheet to find a huge blood stain. The cleaner was working in another room so I went to see her, she came and looked and said 'its not dirty its just a stain'!!! Oh my God what kind of people think this is acceptable? The receptionist did offer to change the whole bedding but I was too disgusted to stay. We left and got a room across the road at a B&B, a family of 3 had to share a double bed but this was better than a night at the Admiral!

Reviews.Title: “beware - bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: visi2r2london
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel in March, and never ever again. I was covered in bedbug bites the next day - unfortunately had an allergic reaction as well so had visit to doctor as a result. The hotel promised to refund my money but after months of emails and getting Trading Standards involved, they finally sent me a cheque but only for half the cost. I also reported them to Environmental Health on advice of my doctor who confirmed bedbugs in the room when they visited about a month later - so no commitment to health and hygiene and subsequent visitors.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!”
Reviews.Author: pstilly
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel i have been to in years if you like being in a nice hotel that has good service and is not so expensive come here its really good!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap - but you get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Familydon
Reviews.Content: We were a family of five (2 adults 3 children 15 10 and 8).. After emailing hotel we were told we would have a newly renovated room with a balcony! What we ended up with was the only basement room (Number 18) that according to the reception was the only room that could accomodate five. The linen was fresh and room was relatively clean. Bathroom was tiled walls to ceiling and musty . Shower was tempremental. Beds were old and uncomfortable and room had only one window with little light... no window or ventilation in the bathroom hence the musty smell. The only saving grace was the large cupboard that could store the luggage as there was no space to move around the beds... This place was fine for us as we spent very little time in the hotel literally only to sleep.. The breakfast also was fine for what you paid for Breakfast was bacon egg sausage beans and tomatoe with toast and orange juice..Staff were also very helpful and friendly. We would

Reviews.Title: “Location is the only good thing about it”
Reviews.Author: JAK45
Reviews.Content: Good location for accessing London shopping and sightseeing, but pokey small room with limited facility and bare minimum breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: globetrotterpup
Reviews.Content: We arrived late in the evening to a room that had water leaking through the light fixture in the bathroom which shorted out our electricity. They have since moved us into 2 other rooms, unpacking and settling in has not been an option because we have now been moved to a third room. The furniture is broken, the bed coverings are torn, the carpet is worn and dirty and the bathrooms are so small that you cannot turn around in them. The rooms themselves are not large enough to fit three people, even if you have reserved a triple room. The breakfast included barely resembles something edible. Overall it feels like a run down hostel and is not worth the price that is paid nightly. This has been an absolutely terrible experience and I would suggest staying at a holiday inn or something well known; at least you know what you're paying for in those places.

Reviews.Title: “Mold in the Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: nikko24
Reviews.Content: We knew that the hotel would not be top line but mold in the bathroom!! The beds were not even beds but matress stacked up on top of each other. There was no alarm clock and no hand soap in the bathroom. The carpet was old and looked like it hadn't been vaccumed in months. The breakfast was OK and the staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: lauraperez15
Reviews.Content: I can only be thankful I just stayed for one night! the bathroom was unbelievably small and really uncomfortable to use. The only good thing was that it was relatively clean. there was no space to put your luggage, so we struggled with this. The people in the reception aren't very helpful so don't expect much help from them. It was January and the heating wasnt working, and neither did the phone or the wireless. There are better places in London for this same price so be sure to book somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Does The Job”
Reviews.Author: aapresley
Reviews.Content: To be honest, I have stayed in many hotels in London and its not generally the individual hotel that is bad but simply the value for money obtained in London as a whole. Infact the Admiral was above average for many of the hotels I have visited although I did read its reviews before booking and was to my surprise that it did not hold the weight of those reviews and the reason I proceeded to book was of a reccommendation. Staff just about give you anything you need and have a 'family' type attitude toward you. During my 8 night stay there I did encounter regulars whom frequented the hotel on a weekly basis and due to the abundance of hotels near by, took this in as a good factor of the place. The stairs can be a teaser if your on the upper floors however. As I brosed with the help of the receptionist, I saw that some rooms had full bathroom/tub and tiled rooms and some were a unit waterproof styled based cabin bathroom. I guess its a matter of preference where mine would not sooo much be the size but more the cleanliness and they, at least mine, were cleaned well daily leaving that antibacterial smell that you would expect from a toilet which had been cleaned well. Breakfast great though you should pop out for one or two days to a local cafe to get an altered taste.

Reviews.Title: “We Booked The Admiral But Got Put In The Kingsway Park Next Door!”
Reviews.Author: merseycat
Reviews.Content: My partner booked this hotel aftering seeing it online, and calling up the owner. It was my birthday so we wanted a nice weekend away in London, something basic, not too far away from the main attractions and not too expensive. The hotel we booked was called the Admiral Hotel. It says on the website that you have to check in at the Kingsway Park hotel, which was situted a few steps away. This was fine. The Admiral looked nice on the website pictures, showing a nice modern bar, and clean rooms. It was this hotel we had booked! Once into the Kingsway Park hotel, we where then told thats where we would be staying. It seems that's where everyone stays! It appeared the nice clean Admiral Hotel was not having guests! This was indeed empty! We checked in early, and where told where our rooms where. As other reviews say, the stairs where very steep and there was no lift or warning which didnt help someone in my party that had a knee complaint, but i havent let that interfere with the review, as i could of enquired upon booking. My room had a terrible smell as soon as i walked in. I wasnt expecting anything less though, as the hotel upon entry was tired, shabby, had a smell to it, and had dirty woodwork and walls, and frayed carpets. The divan bed was 2 singles together, with a badly stained base. The lamps had stained and burnt lampshades. The furniture was dated and didnt fit in the room. There was no fancy chairs and furniture like the i've just seen on the Kingsway Park Hotel website! We kepting hurting ourselves when walking around the crammed room on the furniture. The portable tv did work, but the picture wasnt quite viewable, i felt like i had double vision after looking at it. The main critisim is aimed at the toilet which was a portocabin shower and loo in one type of thing, which was placed in the room, but then was incorporated into the paintwork. It smelt, had mould on the shower, and when sitting on the loo, your foot was in the shower area, which was very small. The bottom of the door was also covered in rust. I did not use the shower at all, as it was very off putting. My partner did, and he was fine with it. The other room we booked, for other parties, was very similar but they had a bath, and a more normal bathroom, which had a terrible smell of damp in it. I didnt sleep well during my two night stay. The bedding was a sheet, and then an extremely 'itchy' blanket, with a floral throw over the top. This was covered in stains. Me and my partner had one small pillow each, there was no other bedding to use. Breakfast was included in the price described as a 'full english' we went down for breakfast which was served in small room crammed with tables in the basement. Two ladies, whom we saw cleaning rooms served breakfast. The option was cereal, toast and the cooked breakfast was a boiled slice of bacon, egg (scrambled,fried or boiled) plum tomato and a sausage. I did not recieve what i ordered for breakfast on both mornings, and didnt rectify it as the person serving breakfast could not fully understand my english. Our bed was made while we where out, and there where towels left in the room. The manager/owner was around for most of the time, and there seemed to be approx 6-7 other guest there, excluding my party. There was no problem returning. The front door was unlocked and there was a gentleman on the desk. The latest we returned was around 11pm. The area of this hotel sussex gardens, has a whole host of hotels similar to this one. They all had vacancies in there window, but did look a lot cleaner and friendlier. I do not recommend this hotel to anyone. It did us for the weekend, because we had no choice once we got there. Location was great for us, lots of restuarants, and paddington station near by, but for the price, which can seem cheap, im sure there are others for the same price in better condition. In my opinion, it wasnt clean, wasnt comfortable, the food wasnt good, so it was a huge let down for me. Luckily the great company i had, and London being so fantastic didnt make my weekend a complete let down. I have written this review within 7 hours of returning as i would hate anyone to have a weekend ruined, and this hotel would do that! Don't be fooled thinking they put you up in the Admiral hotel, when infact your staying at the Kingsway Park. The website for the Kingsway Park Hotel says it has recently been refurbished! Id of hated to of seen what it was like before! Both the Kingsway Park and The Admiral Hotel have individual websites, the pictures on both are extremely different to what you get, so there not worth looking at! Please look at reviews for the Kingsway Park when booking the Admiral as thats where you will probably stay!

Reviews.Title: “Small- that's my only complaint...”
Reviews.Author: ccipollini84
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Admiral from Nov 5th to the 11th of 2007. I kind of understand the less then positive remarkes made about the hotel in some aspects but not all of them . it's location is great and the staff is friendly. Mr. So and Maria you went out of your way to help and I appreciate it immensley! i guess because I don't travel too often and I don't stay in that many hotels I don't have such high and mightly standards, but my room which was at the very top of the hotel as neat and clean as it could be and I just considered the staircase good excercise! The daily breakfast was delicious and the beautiful Hyde park was a short walk away as were all the prime tube stops. It's no big problem to me that the check in is too hotels away. it's like ten steps people, not a huge in convenience! The day I checked out my cab arrived early and on time. A good experiance overall, and I may come back again. My only advice is don't call past 9 pm UK time. The night porter is a total box of rocks!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: tocaSwiss
Reviews.Content: The first thing I found very disturbing is that the actual hotel is two doors down called Kingsway Hotel - don't expect an explanation from anyone for that one. Our room was clean but tiny, on top of a neck breaking stair case! Bathroom was appalling, minute and it smelled like a sewer, probably coming from the shower drain. Staff not very friendly, I've never heard a "hello", "thank you" or "you're welcome" from them. Breakfast is ok but the room itself is a joke. Tables and chairs are crammed together so tight that there is basically not enough room to sit if there are several people in the room! I know that the price is considered as cheap for London standards, but it's still way too expensive for what you're getting out of it ! The only good thing is it's location, very close Paddington Station. Over all - not recommended !!

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Shortmum
Reviews.Content: I wish I had read the other reviews first before booking this Hotel. Our experience is the same as that experienced by reviewers since 2005. The Hotel lobby is that of another hotel 2 addresses down. You don't know this until you arrive. There is no lift in the Hotel. The room was shabby and the sheets had holes in them. The bathroom was minute even by London standards. The shower head could not fit in the bracket in any way but to point directly at the opposite wall rather than downwards. I am under 5 foot and a UK size 8 and could not stand in the shower without the curtain, which smelt, sticking to me as it was so small. The shower also had two large mould patches on the wall. The staff were friendly but there was a dispute over unpaid wages with the kitchen staff as we left which may be an indication why this property has not improved over time. The Enlish breakfast was good and the location great but the rooms terrible. This is not an AA *** Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Scary”
Reviews.Author: heather75b
Reviews.Content: Scary hotel. My room was in the basement and it felt like I was in the cabin of a very small boat. There was a weird skylight/ceiling hatch that let a small amount of light in. There was a ceiling fan that made so much noise you would think it was nuclear-powered. And at night lying in the bed - it almost felt like you were being buried alive. But it was cheap and in walking distance to many good areas - so if you're up for adventure and you plan on not staying in the room more than sleeping hours, I guess you'll be ok.

Reviews.Title: “OK but, comments on specific rooms”
Reviews.Author: reilly850
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with 4 of my friends. We originally had booked two doubles and a single, but when we saw the rooms, we changed to a double and a triple. The single we were shown was in the basement down a small, twisty staircase . It was a tiny, dark room with an even tinier shower stall/WC and none of us wanted it. So two people ended up in room 3, and three of us ended up in room 9. Room 3 wasn't bad. It was the easiest room in the hotel to reach: it was up the first flight of stairs: a straight shot. The room had cross ventilation, and a decent sized shower stall/WC. Room 9 was up a floor or two more and you had to go around corners/landings. 9 did not have cross ventilation, and it was hot! The bathroom was very small, probably like what you would find in a recreational vehicle or a boat. I've included a photo of the bathroom in room 9. Both 3 and 9 looked out the back of the building, really not much of a view, but probably quieter than if we had been fronting Sussex Gardens. The staff was nice, and the breakfasts were fine. The rooms were acceptably clean. The staff did help us bring our bags up when we arrived. You still have to check in with the hotel 2 doors down (same management/ownership.) One possible problem in the future: apparently they have applied to have a bar/club in the evenings on the ground floor. I got the feeling it might be open to the public, not just the people staying there. Not sure how that will work out as far as noise, and security.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all as advertised”
Reviews.Author: jgl1
Reviews.Content: The Admiral hotel at 139 Sussex Gardens is desribed by Orbitz when I booked as "a dedicated staff providing an exceptionally welcoming and friendly atmosphere. (08/05RP) Built originally in the 1850s, this elegant Victorian listed building has recently been thoroughly refurbished to a high standard, combining charm and character." When I arrived I was taken instead to the Kingsway at 143 Sussex Gardens assured it was the same hotel. My room was definitely not to a high standard, had NO charm, NO character and the owner/manager was rude and snooty. When I requested my orignal booking at 139 address, I was shown a hellhole in the basement, no window, next to the kitchen and smelling of kitchen grease. The only bright light was one of the workers did haul my heavy suitcase up the the 5th!! floor - almost vertical stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Bathcloset not bathroom”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Admiral is cheap and in a good location. BUT you have to check in at the Kingsway hotel a few doors down. I guess they own both hotels. The room we stayed in had twin beds and the prefab thing they call a "bathroom". If you are over 5 feet tall you can't close the door when using the toilet and if you're over 6ft tall your head hits the ceiling in the so called "shower". Also there were always friends of the owners hanging out in the lobby and front porch area. I wouldn't recomend staying there to anyone.

HotelInfo.Name: Admiral Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 143 Sussex Gardens | Hyde Park, London W2 2RX, England
